definition: to be particularly attentive to (an attractive young lady or man etc)/to fawn upon (an influential politician etc)/to court sb's favor/to ingratiate oneself
to offer/to present/to dedicate/to donate/to show/to put on display/worthy person (old)
dark red
surname Yin/dynasty name at the end the Shang dynasty, after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province

sentences.english: In order to pine timber, never to the four seasons such as spring greenhouse gallantry.
sentences.chinese: 为了成材，松树从不向四季如春的温室外献殷勤。

sentences.english: I don't like Toby, as he always fawns on the rich.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢托比，因为他老是向有钱人献殷勤。

sentences.english: Gallants gambled away a fortune at a sitting.

今天我要好好对您献殷勤。

sentences.english: I'm not as 2) suave as you are.
sentences.chinese: 我不像你那么会献殷勤。

sentences.english: Lady Windermere. Well, you kept paying me elaborate compliments the whole evening.
sentences.chinese: 一整晚你就是天花乱坠的向我献殷勤。

sentences.english: Cupid and his fleet of angels will be working hard for you!
sentences.chinese: 丘比特和他的小天使们将环绕着你大献殷勤。

sentences.english: He cosied up to Chicago's machine politicians.
sentences.chinese: 他曾向芝加哥政客大献殷勤。

sentences.english: In his eagerness to help her, he knocked the gravy boat flying;
sentences.chinese: 他急于献殷勤，把肉卤盘碰飞了。

sentences.english: No thanks to his gallantry for that.
sentences.chinese: 他向你献殷勤你又何必感激。

sentences.english: David has been rushing that young movie star for nearly half a year.

sentences.english: Alice is so good at dancing attendance on her boss.

sentences.english: Sir Willoughby had practiced a studied courtness upon Vernon and horace .
sentences.chinese: 威洛比爵士向维农和霍拉斯很不自然地献殷勤。

sentences.english: Men often buy women breakfast not for gallantry.
sentences.chinese: 男人经常给女人买早点，并非为了献殷勤。
